title: saucectl espresso runner configuration
description: Configuration file for espresso using saucectl

defaults.description: Settings that are applied onto every suite by default, if no value is set on a suite explicitly.

espresso.description: Contains details specific to the Espresso project.

app.description: Local path or remote url to the application. If a remote url is defined, the app will be downloaded to a local temp directory before uploading to the SauceLabs Mobile App Storage service. Supports environment variables as values.

testApp.description: Local path or remote url to the test application. If a remote url is defined, the app will be downloaded to a local temp directory before uploading to the SauceLabs Mobile App Storage service. Supports environment variables as values.

otherApps.description: A list of applications to be installed alongside the main app. Applications can be defined as a local path or a remote url. If a remote url is defined, the app will be downloaded to a local temp directory before uploading to the SauceLabs Mobile App Storage service. Supports environment variables as values.

suites.description: The set of properties providing details about the test suites to run.

name.description: The name of the test suite, which will be reflected in the test results in Sauce Labs.

testApp.description: Local path or remote url to the test application. If a remote url is defined, the app will be downloaded to a local temp directory before uploading to the SauceLabs Mobile App Storage service. Supports environment variables as values.

testOptions.description: Allows you to control various details on how tests are executed.

notClass.description: Run all classes except those specified here.

func.description: Run all test classes that extend InstrumentationTestCase.

unit.description: Run all test classes that do not extend either InstrumentationTestCase or PerformanceTestCase.

perf.description: Run all test classes that extend PerformanceTestCase.

package.description: Only run tests in the specified package.

notPackage.description: Run all tests except those in this package.

size.description: Run only tests that are annotated with the matching size value.

annotation.description: Only run tests with this annotation.

notAnnotation.description: Run all tests except those with this annotation.

filter.description: Only run tests that pass all of the custom filters.

runnerBuilder.description: Use custom builders to run tests.

listener.description: Observe the test run with one or more RunListener.

newRunListenerMode.description: Use the new list of RunListeners during a test run.

numShards.description: When sharding is configured, saucectl automatically creates the sharded jobs for each of the devices defined for the suite based on the number of shards you specify. For example, for a suite testing a single emulator version that specifies 2 shards, saucectl clones the suite and runs one shard index on the first suite, and the other shard index on the identical clone suite.

clearPackageData.description: Removes all shared states from the testing device's CPU and memory at the completion of each test. Real devices only. Has to be used in conjunction with the 'useTestOrchestrator' flag.

useTestOrchestrator.description: Run each of your tests in its own Instrumentation instance to remove most of the app's shared state from the device CPU and memory between tests. Real devices only. Use this setting in conjunction with clearPackageData: true to completely remove all shared state.

emulators.description: Defines details for running this suite on virtual devices using an emulator.

name.description: The name of the emulator. To ensure name accuracy, check the list of supported virtual devices (https://app.saucelabs.com/live/web-testing/virtual).

platformVersions.description: The set of one or more versions of the device platform on which to run the test suite.

devices.description: Define details for running this suite on real devices.

id.description: Request a specific device for this test suite by its ID. You can look up device IDs in the Sauce Labs app or using our Devices API (https://docs.saucelabs.com/dev/api/rdc#get-devices).

name.description: Match the device name in full or partially (regex), which may provide a larger pool of available devices of the type you want.

platformVersion.description: The version of the Android operating system.

options.description: Further specify desired device attributes within the pool of devices that match the name and version criteria.

carrierConnectivity.description: Limit the device selection to those that are connected to a cellular network.

deviceType.description: Limit the device selection to a specific type of device.

private.description: Limit the device selection to only match from your organization's private pool.
